title: Taking Additional Steps With Respect to the Situation in Syria

enrichment.summary: This Executive Order updates previous sanctions and restrictions related to Syria by amending earlier orders to reflect changing conditions on the ground. It revises the criteria for targeting individuals and entities involved with the Syrian conflict and clarifies implementation rules for related national emergency authorities. The order helps maintain economic pressure and restricts support to certain actors tied to the Syrian situation.
potential_concerns: Sanctions may inadvertently harm civilian populations in Syria and neighboring countries benefiting from humanitarian aid.
The amendment of targeting criteria could create legal uncertainties for businesses and persons doing legitimate commerce involving Syria.
Maintaining broad national emergency authorities may raise concerns about executive overreach and limited congressional oversight.
Changes in language removing references to Turkey might signal shifts in regional policy that could complicate diplomatic relations.
Enforcement complexity may increase given the nuanced support definitions for blocked persons and entities, potentially impacting compliance.
